title: Man is crushed by a falling piano in horror workplace accident at a warehouse in Seven Hills
text:
A warehouse worker has been left with suspected spinal injuries after he was struck by a falling container in Seven Hills on Wednesday morning.

The 26-year-old man had been unloading the box, holding a piano, about 9am when it fell and crushed him, leaving him with injuries to his lower back.

A spokesman for NSW Police said he and a workmate had attempted to lower the box at the warehouse when it fell on the 26-year-old.

The man was taken to Westmead Hospital via road ambulance, though Careflight was also called to the scene.

He is in a stable condition and the matter has been referred to Safe Work NSW.
description: A warehouse worker has been left with suspected spinal injuries after he was struck by a falling pallet in Seven Hills on Wednesday morning.
authors: Hannah Moore For Daily Mail Australia
